text: @vikingwanderer now THAT'S an idea I can get behind.

@bronx_nutmeg yes, I used the "man up" phrase because to be a man should mean be decent, against abuse and bullying. The bullies and abusive men are not real men. Real men are strong to protect, not to attack the weak. Real men step up and say no to this kind of behavior. It takes a lot more courage to go against the violent. To be a bully is easy, to fight the bully you need a real man. So yeah, man up everybody 😜

I mean, I know they did it for money (no business that big does something just because it's the right thing to do), but I'm happy to see that standing with women is the profitable choice for Gillette. "Boys will be boys" has been used as an excuse for violence and misogyny for far too long. I do hope this inspires good men to stand up to their friends who exhibit this shitty behavior. Only complaint about this photo is the expression "man up," which I feel has been used to shame men and boys who aren't masculine enough. But maybe this is a new definition of the phrase, than man up means be better.

completely agree with this :) it takes courage and the strength from real men by standing with women! My Book "What is Pusillanimous...The basics of masculinity and femininity" satirically demonstrates 10 toxic masculine traits and provides guidance on how to be a better man! At the same time it allows women to understand how they are allowing and in some cases re-enforcing such behavior! #pusillanimous #polarityexpert #masculinityfeminity
